content.description:
A fun and unique climb for the grade. Two tough moves keep you motivated for the huge rest in the top pod. Tricky move out to the chains. Overall a stellar warm up for those cold winter days.

Classic.
content.location:
Right of

Holy Shit

, this route climbs a rope up a slab to start. Follow the huge pods.

content.description: An extension of Raising Cain, Spring Loaded tackles the tough and wicked roof straight off the Raising Cain anchor. A hard 12 in itself, linked from the ground this makes a nice and thuggy .13 - Pull hard on the pockets and thin edges, underclings and a few tough pinches. Get psyched, the business starts early.
content.location: This route is an extension above Raising Cain on the far left side.

content.description:
I had heard rumors about this climb for quite a while. As it turns out the legends are true. Limestone fit for the Gods!

Although many of the holds are slick from traffic, this route is truly a 5-star sloper workout.

Move on easy holds to the large hueco half-way up. Try to rest without slipping out. Make a large move and work through the crux finding knee-bars wherever you can. Rest in the large undercling and then prepare for a tough final move to clip the chains. Old stiff perma-draws make every clip a rush!
content.location: Right hand side of the cave. Follows the obvious huge pods and huecos.

content.description: Starts up an easy slab to some harder than it looks moves, clip a double long draw, then stand up and clip another off of a left hand side pull and then climb back down into the pod and rest up. Moving back out of the pod make a big right hand move followed by a heel-hand match to an undercling, from here you gain a big jug hueco and clip another short draw. Rest here again, the crux cometh: large dyno to a left hand pocket followed by a handful of moderately hard moves gains the finish jug of the crux. stem up inside and head right along a sloping arete to clip the shared anchors for Speaking in Tongues. If you head straight up after the crux you're on Golden.

The most direct line up the cave, Dan Mirsky found a bolt that Joe Kinder had placed in between Golden and Golden Direct, and spent 5 months battling conditions to send the hardest route at Cathedral.
content.location: Climb the first four bolts of Space Shuttle to do the big move left at the crux then continue straight the center of the main steep wall via a boulder problem to get to the 'good' flake on Golden Direct, then do the rest of the Golden Direct boulder problem into Golden.

content.description: Start on Pagan Rituals and break right after the first few bolts.  Pull through some thinner moves to a tough bulge and even tougher clip of the chains.
content.location: Shared start with Pagan Rituals, breaking right to a separate anchor

content.description: A short, but sweet route using decent edges and pockets. Begin on a vertical face and head up to the roof, plenty of powerful moves on this line, Move fast!
content.location: The first route on the left hand side of the cave, it starts on a vertical face and heads up to a roof.

content.description: Every type of limestone move, pockets, crimps, jugs, a lieback sequence, and even a tufa pinch with bat guano. The crux is either between the 3rd and 4th bolt or at the top depending on how well you can lieback.
content.location: Center of the cave just up from a pothole, right of a pre-hung 5.12 (black slings no water knots)

content.description:
This is the first route at the Cathedral and one of the longest - it takes a traversing line linking great natural features before busting straight up to the rim for the final few clips.  Several cruxes and good rests comprise this wonderful pump-fest.

Begin as for

Speaking in Tongues

(by far a more popular route - though it shouldn't be) on the right side of the cave.  A difficult undercling move that isn't so bad if you can stay glued to the glassy feet leads to better holds.  There's a shallow no-hands knee bar before the route moves right where

Tongues

moves left.  Here you must pass two very poorly placed bolts - they are too low and too far to the right of the climbing, making the clips difficult and the climbing unsettling.  In any case, move right to a huge hueco, then right again to a smaller, but perhaps better one that is home to an abandoned peregrine nest.  Hope that there is a long sling on the next bolt as you move up on some cobbles in a shallow depression on the wall.  A few more moves up and right around an arete-like feature lead to a great stance and opportunity for complete recovery.  Easy stemming up a corner culminates in a big move to a good hole, and another rest before the final run to the chains:  This section is steep and uncharacteristically crimpy, but it also has the nicest rock.  The anchor is tough to clip.

Use a 70m cord and when you lower redirect through a midway chain anchor to land on the starting platform. With a shorter rope you'll need to lower twice using the aforementioned anchor.
Difficult moves to gain a shallow dihedral.  Sharp holds to slab.  The crux is right off the ground.  The rock is not on par with the other routes at the Cathedral.
content.location: Starts below and to the right of the main Cathedral platform in a dihedral.

content.description: to the right of raising cain. not that great.

Joe Kinder's Direct start to Golden starts on The Epiphany (5.11d), then moves into Golden above and to the right of the anchors. This eliminates the pod rest and adds some hard moves in the territory between the two routes.
content.location: Start as for The Epiphany, then move right past the anchors to connect with Golden.

content.description: The original Golden is an extension of Space Shuttle to Kolob, moving out and left from the pod where Space Shuttle finishes and continuing up for 70' more of solid climbing. Todd Perkins, responsible for much of the route development at Welcome Springs, left this as an open project which Chris Sharma first completed.
content.location: On the right side of the split between the two largest pods in the middle of Cathedral

content.description: Lovely 5.11+ to a no hands kneebar, then a v7ish shoulder press boulder problem, endng on the upper section of Natural Born Drillers.
content.location: Ambles up dihedral cave to the right of Speaking in Tongues

content.description: Up blunt arete to hueco, then hard pockets to anchor.
content.location: Start to the left of Space Shuttle to Kolob and to the right of Sacrilege, inside the right side of the left cave.
